intro: [WRONG START] Boronia sphaerosperma, commonly known as the globular boronia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive spherical seed pods. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and sandy regions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is a valued species in native gardens and conservation efforts.
